p: A mulch, consisting of white sugar (sucrose) and sawdust, was added to the soil to increase microbial populations and CO 2 production, while also contributing to a reduction in soil nitrogen [ 32, 33]. Each of the selected plots was treated by evenly spreading 12.5 kg of white sugar over the entire plot, followed by the addition of 20 kg of sawdust, to a depth of approximately 5 cm over the soil surface.
